intro: Sipaneopsis maguirei, commonly known as the Maguire's sipaneopsis, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the wet season. Sipaneopsis maguirei is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as cloud forests. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
